data.text: @ShanaWestlake Yep, my third birth was the easiest (and fastest! whoa!) and the recovery was super fast.

And lastly, it's not like she's going back to the office! She's going home to rest and learn how to be a mother of three. And she has a lot of help! She'll have home visits from medical professionals. She will deal with all the post-pregnancy stuff too. Just at home.
Most deliveries are not easy! Most moms aren't up and smiling and walking around after giving birth. But I can completely understand how Kate looked so good after giving birth that morning.

With my second, I woke up in labor after a decent night's sleep. Had my son by 2:09pm after only 15 minutes of pushing. Avoided the epidural and recovery was much easier on my body than with my first. Had I not had a massive sinus infection, I would have felt great after birth.

It's her third baby, so her body knew what it was doing. She probably wasn't in labor for too long. She didn't have an epidural with her last two babies, so skipping it this time probably made walking around a lot easier afterwards.
